column4: it is? now that i dont have linux on the computer, just two windows 7's, is grub in one of the windows 's or does it have its own partition or where is it now?
I believe it caches itself to the harddrive
so if i deleted one of my windows 7's would grub be deleted again?
can I ask you why you didn't just uninstall windows?
well hope you give linux another chance some time...
because windows is stupid and i dont know how, deleting the partitions just seemed so much easier!
but you deleted the linux partition though?  Guess I'm a bit confused at this point

oh i love linux WAY more then windows, im on linux on my laptop right now. but i installed 32 bit ubuntu on our family computer by mistake when its a 64 bit system, so the drivers and stuff wernt working, thats why im getting rid of it
and everyone else: but to me the 32 bit seems like it works pretty smoothly compared to using a 64 bit and for example with 64 flash

yah, personaly i dont really see the difference, and for all the hassle of now i cant have windows xp <the windows i do like> or vista on the new 64 bit computer, so i cant dualboot it, and the audio editing software i love <cool edit pro 2.0, before it was bought out by adobe> isnt windows 7 compatible
the cache of the hard drive
i feel really stupid for saying this, but what is the cashe? what does it mean
I might be wrong about the cache part
and okay, well atleast i know what cashe is now :P
